speakers.Name: Aasim Mansuri
speakers.Bio:
Aasim Mansuri is the Principal Researcher and Center Head- Strategy with over 15 years of experience in managing citywide inclusive sanitation (CWIS), climate-resilient WASH systems, and WASH-focused development programs across India, Nepal, Bangladesh, and Zambia. 

Aasim has been associated with CWAS since 2010. Aasim has extensive experience working with governments and sector partners at all levels— national, state, and city—for the planning and implementation of WASH initiatives. He spearheads CWAS's efforts in supporting climate-resilient water and sanitation programs in small and medium towns of Gujarat and Maharashtra, focusing on Water Security, Citywide Inclusive Sanitation (CWIS), and Faecal Sludge and Septage Management (FSSM). He leads the implementation of the CWIS program of the Gates Foundation (GF) in Wai city, Maharashtra, and has successfully led the planning and rollout of India's first scheduled desludging services under the GF-DFID Program and further in Kabwe, Zambia, under the SNV program. 

Recognized for his expertise in water and sanitation management, Aasim has made significant contributions to policy, governance, and implementation strategies. He combines a strategic vision with proven leadership and management skills, excelling in stakeholder engagement, financial management, communication, and team development. He is an active member of the Technical Working Group of JMP-WHO, helping shape global indicators for climate-resilient WASH, and a member of the National Faecal Sludge and Septage Management (NFSSM) Alliance, advocating for FSSM and Climate Resilient Sanitation at the National level. 

His contributions extend to academic activities, where he actively engages in CEPT University’s educational programs through studio reviews, Internships, and DRPs.

He is a technical and project management professional with Executive Education from Harvard Business School, a Master's degree in Urban (Infrastructure) Planning from CEPT University, and a B.Tech in Civil Engineering from Nirma University.

speakers.Name: Dhruv Bhavsar
speakers.Bio:
Dhruv Bhavsar is an urban planning and development professional with over 15 years of extensive experience in the field of urban infrastructure, urban finance, urban development, and urban housing. His work focuses on key thematic areas in the water and sanitation sector, spanning sector monitoring, governance, and finance; municipal and public finance; climate-resilient infrastructure; technology-driven innovation; equity and gender inclusion; and institutional capacity building.

Dhruv has been associated with CWAS since 2009. He has extensive experience in the WASH sector in India and Nepal.

At CWAS, he leads initiatives on performance assessment systems in water and sanitation, covering 800+ cities across India. He serves as a technical advisor to the Government of Maharashtra, supporting the Swachh Maharashtra Abhiyan for Urban Areas since 2015. He also oversees work on urban and rural water security, climate resilience, and energy transition in waste management, tech-enabled WASH solutions, and national capacity-building initiatives under the Swachhata Knowledge Partners.

Dhruv holds a Master’s in Planning (Housing) from CEPT University, Ahmedabad, and a Bachelor’s in Civil Engineering from M.S. University, Vadodara. He has a diploma certificate, Graduate Professional Diploma Program in Sanitation from IHE Delft, The Netherlands.

He is an alumnus of the Global Sanitation Graduate School (GSGS) and actively contributes to academia through the GSGS network of universities. He supports the Faculty of Planning at CEPT University for rolling out the GSGS project. He has guided and mentored over 15 postgraduate students of CEPT for their theses and directed research projects.

speakers.Name: Dr. Barjor Mehta
speakers.Bio:
Barjor Mehta is an architect and an urban development professional who served as the Lead Urban Specialist in the East Asia Urban and Disaster Risk Management team at the World Bank's China Country Office in Beijing. During his professional journey, he held urban development positions across multiple continents, with significant tenures in India's New Delhi office (2012-2016) and Tanzania's Dar es Salaam office (2009-2012), also overseeing initiatives in Tanzania, Uganda, and Kenya.
 Before these assignments, Barjor’s expertise spanned comprehensive urban planning and risk management projects across the Middle East, North Africa, Sub-Saharan Africa, East Asia, and South Asia, reflecting his global perspective and deep professional versatility.
Before joining the World Bank, he served as Associate Professor of Urban Planning from 1990 to 1995, and later as Director of the School of Planning at CEPT University (now called the Faculty of Planning) from 1995 to 1997. He has made significant contributions to urban planning projects in Sri Lanka, Thailand, Bhutan, and the United States. Barjor began his professional journey in 1981, working on UN-HABITAT’s urban planning initiative in Sri Lanka.
 An alumnus (1974) of the CEPT’s UG Program of the Faculty of Architecture and a Master’s in Human Settlements Planning from the Asian Institute of Technology, Bangkok, Barjor’s vision and leadership continue to drive impactful, forward-thinking solutions for sustainable urban growth.

speakers.Name: Dr. Dinesh Mehta
speakers.Bio:
Dinesh Mehta is a Professor Emeritus and Senior Advisor at the Center for Water and Sanitation. He has over four decades of experience in urban policy, urban planning and management, in Asia and Africa.
 He was involved in global urban policy and dialogue as the head of Urban Management Programme at the UN-Habitat headquarters in Nairobi. He also contributed significantly to urban policy formulation by Government of India, while he was a Director of the National Institute of Urban Affairs, New Delhi, India. He was also the Director of School of Planning at CEPT University, Ahmedabad, India during 1986-1992. In 2013, Professor Mehta was awarded International Water Association’s Development Solutions Award in recognition of his contribution to research and practice in Water. In 2017 became a fellow of IWA and Chair of their specialist group on water and sanitation in developing countries
 He has a PhD from University of Pennsylvania, a Master’s in City and Regional Planning from Harvard University, and a Bachelor of Technology in Civil Engineering, IIT, Madras, India.

speakers.Name: Dr. Meera Mehta
speakers.Bio: Meera Mehta is a Professor Emeritus at CRDF, CEPT University and the Senior Advisor of the Center for Water and Sanitation. She has over 45 years of experience in water, urban development and infrastructure finance. Her experience spans countries in Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa. She served as the Director of School of Planning at the University in 1992, before joining the USAID’s FIRE-D Project in India. Later she worked with the World Bank in India and its Water and Sanitation Program in Africa. She has consulted widely for national and international agencies, including for World Bank, WHO, ADB, UNICEF, USAID, DFID and WaterAid. She has served on the boards of the Stockholm-based inter-governmental organization Global Water Partnership (GWP) and of IRC, a global not-for-profit organization.

speakers.Name: Dr. Suren Vakil
speakers.Bio:
Suren Vakil is an accomplished professional in infrastructure engineering consultancy with over 35 years of experience in the UK and India. He has a distinguished career managing infrastructure projects, including significant contributions to disaster management after the Gujarat earthquake and developing containers and LNG terminals. His portfolio includes more than 400 projects in over twenty-five countries and technical specialisation in water pollution control and wastewater engineering. Suren has established and led Indian operations for prominent UK-based international companies, Babtie Group and BMT (British Maritime Technology). Throughout his career, he has successfully guided teams in ports, logistics, and environmental sectors. He has vast hands-on experience with PPP infrastructure projects in the UK and India.
 He currently serves as the Vice Chairperson of the CEPT Research & Development Foundation. As Vice Chairperson, Suren is responsible for providing strategic leadership and enhancing governance capabilities and operational systems to ensure CRDF delivers high-quality outcomes. He is also committed to promoting and strengthening a culture of research and collaboration within CRDF.
 His academic background includes a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering and a Master's in Environmental Engineering from Leeds University. He is a UK-certified chartered engineer and chartered environmental manager and has previously represented the Institution of Civil Engineers in a regional capacity. He also has a Certificate in Company Directorship from the UK Institute of Directors. 
 Suren has a keen interest in reading history and popular science, and he enjoys capturing moments through amateur photography.

speakers.Name: Aloka Majumdar
speakers.Bio:
Aloka Majumdar is Managing Director, Global Head of Philanthropy & Head of Sustainability, India at HSBC.
In her capacity as Global Head of Philanthropy Aloka focusses on overseeing the execution of HSBC’s global philanthropy strategy working closely with multiple stakeholders. 
Aloka heads Sustainability for HSBC Group in India, which comprises the Bank and other HSBC companies and lead the fulfillment of the growing sustainability priorities and initiatives for the Group in India.
She is a member of the HSBC India Operating Committee (OpCo).
Her expertise lies in the fields of Financial Inclusion, Skills development and Climate Change. She has worked extensively with a wide range of stakeholders that include community-based organisations, multilateral agencies, the academia and central and state governments. She was awarded the Parivartan Sustainability Leadership Award in 2016 and recognized by Social Venture Partners (SVP) with Grant Thornton (knowledge partner) as a women exemplar in 2019.
Graduating with Honours in Political Science from University of Calcutta, Aloka started her career as a financial journalist, specializing in covering Banking and Finance.

speakers.Name: Dr. Patrick Moriarty
speakers.Bio: Patrick Moriarty is Chief Executive Officer of IRC, an international think-and-do tank dedicated to building strong national water, sanitation and hygiene systems. He also serves as Chair of the Steering Committee of Sanitation and Water for All (SWA), a global partnership uniting governments, civil society, the private sector and development partners to realise the human rights to water and sanitation. Patrick has over three decades of experience working with governments and utilities, with a particular focus on service delivery, finance and governance for climate-resilient, inclusive WASH services at scale. A recognised systems leader and coalition-builder, he works to connect local innovation with national and global reform, and is committed to putting evidence, politics and people at the centre of decision-making. He is a regular advisor and speaker at global water forums.

speakers.Name: Dr. Silver Mugisha
speakers.Organization: National Water and Sewerage Corporation, Uganda
speakers.Bio:
Dr. Eng. Silver Mugisha is the Managing Director of National Water and Sewerage Corporation (NWSC) Uganda, one for the well performing water and sanitation utilities in Africa. Mugisha holds a Ph.D. in Engineering and Economics of Makerere University - Uganda; MSc in Sanitary Engineering (Sector Utility Management) from IHE Delft-Netherlands; and BSc. Civil Engineering - Makerere University - Uganda. His PhD research, which was carried out in collaboration with PURC of University of Florida, USA focused on areas of performance monitoring, incentive design and productivity analysis. 
Dr. Mugisha brings over 30 years of industry leadership, organizational transformation expertise and excutive management experience to one of the well performing utilities in Africa. Dr. Mugisha has worked and supported, organizational and performance improvement, for various organizations in Uganda, Kenya, Tanzania, Zambia, Nigeria, Ethiopia, Rwanda, India, and Trinidad and Tobago among others. 
Dr Mugisha is very active in the water sector as well as in the community. He was a Board Member of the International Water Association (IWA), 2014-2016 and later become the Vice President of IWA (2016-2018).
 He is the President Emeritus of the African Water and Sanitation Association (AfWASA) (2020-2025). He is also the Chairman Emeritus of the following Boards; Governing Council of the Federation of Uganda Employers (FUE); Uganda Business and Technical Examinations Board (UBTEB), Uganda Technical College Bushenyi, and a Board member of Umeme Ltd (an electricity distributor).
He is currently a Board member of National Security Fund (NSSF), a registered engineer with Engineers Registration Board (ERB), and a member of Uganda Institute of Professional Engineers (UIPE). 
Dr Mugisha is a Fellow of the International Water Association and Sense Research School of the Netherlands. He is the author of more than 50 peer reviewed papers, two books, and chapters of books published internationally.
He is very passionate about service delivery, knowledge and professional development. His leadership and commitment have been key in helping many water utilities especially in Africa on their drive towards water and sanitation for All.

speakers.Name: Kate Medlicott
speakers.Bio: Kate Medlicott is the Sanitation and Waste team leader within the WASH team at the World Health Organization in Geneva, Switzerland. In this role Kate is responsible for translating evidence to policy and practice through WHO guidelines on sanitation, safe use of wastewater and recreational water, and also health sector collaborations where sanitation is a critical component of risk and disease control such as antimicrobial resistance and neglected tropical diseases. Kate is also coordinating WHO’s technical activities on multi-pathogen wastewater and environmental surveillance.

speakers.Name: Neeta Pokhrel
speakers.Organization: Water and Urban Development Sector, Asian Development Bank, Philippines
speakers.Bio: Neeta Pokhrel is currently the Director of Water and Urban Development Sector Office at the Asian Development Bank (ADB). She leads the Pacific and Southeast Asia regional team at the Water and Urban Development Sector Office of ADB. An engineer by training; water, sanitation, climate change, and environmental optimist, and a passionate development worker, she has over 28 years of professional experience working with various organizations including the ADB, Bovis Lend Lease Pty Ltd Australia, engineering consulting firms, water utilities, and international non-government organizations.

speakers.Name: Osward Chanda
speakers.Bio: Osward brings over 30 years of expertise in water and sanitation, with two decades spent in senior management positions encompassing development finance, utility regulation, and institutional change management. He served as Director of the Water at the African Development Bank, he expanded the department’s portfolio to $5.5 billion, annual lending to $1 billion, and led a special fund for project preparation. He oversaw the development and implementation of policies and strategies to improve inclusive access, foster public-private partnerships, and strengthen climate change resilience. In Zambia, Osward was instrumental in pioneering sector reforms, utility regulation and building strategic partnerships, successfully raising more than $170 million for a pro-poor Trust Fund. A committed mentor, he holds degrees from the University of Melbourne and the University of Zambia.

speakers.Name: Dr. Alejandro Jimenez
speakers.Bio:
Alejandro leads the Water and Sanitation Department. His team provides advice, develops tools and methodologies, and conducts research, trainings and workshops on governance issues, to achieve sustainable and resilient water and sanitation services.

Alejandro joined SIWI in 2013 and also leads the Content Development on water governance for the organization. He has over 15 years of experience working with water governance issues around the world.

Prior to joining SIWI, Alejandro worked for the private sector, for NGOs, and academia, and as consultant for international organizations. He has authored several publications related to water and sanitation governance, resilience, and the implementation of the human rights to water and sanitation.

Alejandro holds a MsC in Civil Engineering, a PhD in rural water governance.

speakers.Name: Dr. Harish Ahuja
speakers.Organization:
Sustainability; Power & Carbon Markets, Listing, Investor Awareness & Services, Social Stock Exchange, NSE, India
National Stock Exchange
speakers.Bio: Dr. Harish Ahuja is the Head, Product & Strategy Development (Power & Carbon Markets), Primary Market relationship and Investor awareness/services at National Stock Exchange (NSE). He is an ex-civil servant having 25 years of experience primarily in energy markets & infrastructure finance space both in government and corporate sector. Prior to joining corporate sector in 2011, he has served in Ministry of Power, Govt. of India, Government of NCT of Delhi & Andaman & Nicobar islands. He had also taken an entrepreneurial journey as founder of India go solar – India’s 1st Solar Ecommerce marketplace. Harish has done MTech from IIT Delhi & pursued his MBA from NTU Singapore.He also holds a PhD in electricity markets from IIT, Delhi & authored a book “Reforming power sector reforms: multiple conflicts, democratic solution”.

speakers.Name: Dr. Kalimuthu Arumugam Pillai
speakers.Bio:
AK with 34 years of experience in the development sector with a strong focus on Water supply, Sanitation and Hygiene, is an Expert in Sanitation Technologies, Rural and Urban sanitation, Faecal Sludge and Septage Management, Water quality, Water Resource Management, Participatory Techniques and Training & Capacity Building. He has worked at all levels from National Government policy support to grassroots implementation formulating programs, strategically plan initiatives, and implement effective community services. Before joining WASH Institute, AK served at leading positions in renowned organizations such as Water For People, Plan International (India) and WaterAid (India & Nepal). 

As WASH Institute's Executive Director, Arumugam Kalimuthu (AK) is responsible for the overall management of WASH Institute program profile. AK is the Chief of Party for the Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) Technical Assistance program unit of WASH Institute in New Delhi, which is supported by USAID and the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. 

As a technical expert, AK has been representing top level committees of Government of India namely SACOSAN-VI Planning Committee and Committee on Ganga Action Plan on Sanitation technology of Ministry of Drinking Water Supply and Sanitation (MoDWS), Whole School Development Committee of Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan, Water and Sanitation Road Map development committee, Govt. of Bihar and National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA). He is also part of an eminent panel on Circular Economy constituted by MoHUA. Also, AK is part of Program Coordination Mechanism (PCM) of Global Sanitation Fund (GSF) and Eminent Jury member of FICCI Award on Sanitation and Water Digest Water Awards. AK has also served as National Convener of National Faecal Sludge & Septage Management (NFSSM) Alliance. AK is also a Member of National Technical Advisory Committee on SLWM, DDWS, Ministry of Jal Shakti, Govt. of India. AK has published several technical papers and guidebooks on water and sanitation.

speakers.Name: Dr. Rajul Gajjar
speakers.Bio:
Dr. Rajul K. Gajjar is an eminent academic leader and a distinguished figure in the field of engineering education, with over four decades of experience in academia, research, and administration. She has significantly contributed to the advancement of engineering and technical education in India. She holds a Doctorate in Structural Disasters from M.S. University, Baroda, along with her UG and PG degrees from L.D. College of Engineering. Throughout her career, Dr. Gajjar has been a driving force behind academic excellence, research, innovation, industry collaborations, and skill development.
Dr. Gajjar has an extensive research background with over 66 National and International Research Publications, four authored books, and three granted patents to her credit. She has supervised more than 30 PG and 8 Doctoral students and led over 38 high-impact projects, covering areas such as international collaborations, Centers of Excellence, research innovation, accreditation, and ranking frameworks for excellence in engineering education. Her contributions to research and innovation are evident in GTU’s outstanding achievements, including publishing 160+ patents, 1,700 registered Ph.D. scholars, and 683 research articles in SCI journals.

speakers.Name: Dr. Ramnath Jha
speakers.Bio:
Dr. Ramanath Jha belongs to the 1977 batch of the IAS. In the 80s and 90s, he worked as Administrator Pandharpur Municipal Council, Administrator & Municipal Commissioner Solapur, Collector & Deputy Director Municipal Administration, Ahmednagar, Municipal Commissioner Pune and Metropolitan Commissioner, MMRDA. His subsequent postings were as Regional Advisor, South Asia for the Urban Management Programme of the UNDP/UN-Habitat, Vice Chairman & Managing Director of MSRDC and Principal Secretary, Transport, Ports and State Excise, GoM. He received the State Government’s Chinmulgund award for administrative excellence in 1989. He sought voluntary retirement from Government in 2008 and joined the private sector as CEO & MD, Khed Economic Infrastructure Pvt. Ltd. He is currently Chairman, Mumbai Heritage Conservation Committee (MHCC), Chairman, Mumbai Commission for Art, Culture and Music (MCAMC), Adviser, Mumbai Parking Authority (MPA), Director General, MCGM’s Centre for Capacity Building & Research (MCMCR) and Distinguished Fellow, Observer Research Foundation (ORF).

Dr. Jha led the Mumbai DP team for preparing the Development Plan Mumbai 2034 (2015-2019). He was a member of the Expert Group on Economic Revival of Maharashtra post Covid-19 Lockdown, member of the Transparency Committee, GoM for suggesting reforms in urban local bodies, member of the Expert Committee for the preparation of the Model Municipal Law commissioned by GoI, member of the Expert Panel for Property Tax Reforms in Delhi, member of the Expert Panel for National Urban Awards instituted by CRISIL and Chairman of the Committee of GoM for framing the bill on Metropolitan Planning Committee. He was also the DG of All India Institute of Local Self Government (AIILSG).

He co-authored a book “Towards People Friendly Studies” published by UNICEF and “Urban Essays” published by YASHADA. He was Editor of the “City Development Strategy for Hyderabad” published by UN-Habitat, “Perspectives in Urban Development” published by Symbiosis and theme mentor for two modules “Urban Governance” and “Municipal Management” prepared by YASHADA. He has published a number of papers on a variety of urban subjects and lectures widely on urban issues.

speakers.Name: Mr. Abdu Maliki Muyinda
speakers.Organization: Ministry of Water and Environment in Uganda
speakers.Bio:
Mr. Muyinda Abdu Maliki is a Senior Economist working in the Water Utility Regulation Department of Ministry of Water and Environment in Uganda, where he has served since 2015. He leads the commercial and financial regulation of water supply and sanitation services, with a strong focus on performance monitoring, tariff regulation, non-revenue water (NRW) management, and improving operational efficiencies across Uganda’s water utilities.
He has been instrumental in advancing data-driven regulation in Uganda, including the development and operationalization of the Regulatory Management Information System (REMIS) to enhance data integrity and performance monitoring. He also played a central role in establishing national water utility performance baselines in collaboration with development partners, and in supporting the rollout of Weyonje, a key initiative for improving urban sanitation service provision.
His leadership in urban sanitation regulation includes spearheading the development of the sanitation regulation framework based on Citywide Inclusive Sanitation (CWIS), the CWIS implementation roadmap, and the piloting of sanitation planning tools such as EquiServe and the Town Sanitation Planning Tool (TSP) for investment planning, resource targeting, and cost-of-service analysis.
Regionally, he has been an active member of the ESAWAS Technical Committee on Regulatory Issues since 2019, contributing to key initiatives such as the development of NRW guidelines, the sanitation regulation roadmap, EQUISERVE piloting, rural WASH regulation frameworks, sanitation landscape mapping, and publications on accountability and resourcing for WASH.
Before joining the Ministry, he worked with VEDCO (2009–2012) on livelihood transformation, business planning, and monitoring and evaluation. He later served at Makerere University (2012–2017) on major research projects focused on public health, vulnerability, and digital service linkage for vulnerable children.
He holds a Bachelor’s degree in Economics and Statistics (Kyambogo University), a Postgraduate Diploma in Monitoring and Evaluation, and currently finalising his research for Master’s degree in Management Science (Uganda Management Institute), and Master’s degree in Quantitative Economics (Makerere University).

speakers.Name: Mr. Kwabena Nyarko
speakers.Organization: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science & Technology, Ghana
speakers.Bio:
Kwabena Biritwum Nyarko is a Professor in the Department of Civil Engineering at the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology (KNUST), Kumasi, Ghana. He has over 30 years of teaching and research experience in Water and Sanitation, with research interests spanning water transport and distribution, sanitation technologies, and sustainable water and sanitation service delivery. He currently serves as the Provost of the College of Engineering at KNUST and is a valued member of the Regional Water and Sanitation Centre, Kumasi (RWESCK). He also serves on the Board of the Engineering Council of Ghana and is a Council Member of the Ghana Institution of Engineers.
Prof. Nyarko led the KNUST component of the Rural Evidence and Learning for Water (REAL Water) project, led by the Aquaya Institute (USA) and funded by USAID, which evaluated strategies for expanding access to safe and sustainable rural water in developing countries. He also led the Ghana component of the WASHCost research project, which examined the cost of providing WASH services indefinitely. In addition, he served as Project Lead for the KNUST Engineering Education Project (KEEP), one of the World Bank’s flagship ACE Centres in West Africa, focused on strengthening access to high-quality postgraduate engineering education.
He has authored more than 100 publications, including peer-reviewed journal articles, conference papers, book chapters, working papers, technical reports, and briefing notes.

speakers.Name: Mr. Nitin Bassi
speakers.Organization: Council on Energy, Environment and Water, India
speakers.Bio:
Nitin is a Fellow for the Sustainable Water Team at The Council. He has more than 19 years of experience undertaking research, consultancy, and training in water resources. His work areas include river basin water accounting, agriculture water management, institutional and policy analysis in irrigation and water supply management, water quality analysis, climate-induced water risk assessment, and wetland management.

He was part of the delegation of the Ministry of Jal Shakti, Government of India for the second Environment and Climate Sustainability Working Group Meeting under India’s G20 Presidency (2022-23). Additionally, he was a nominated member of the National Institute of Urban Affairs (NIUA), Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA), Government of India (GoI) Task Force that developed the White Paper on the U20 priority area 'Ensuring Water Security'.

He played a key role in establishing the India-EU Water Partnership and its work priority areas (2015-2020). He was a Member of the Water Quality Task Force (River Ganga), set up by the Ministry of Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation, GoI (2017). He was also a Member of the thematic sub-group on Water Management for Climate-Smart Cities Assessment Framework 2.0, set up by the NIUA, MoHUA, GoI (2020-21). He is a core team member of the Delhi Water Forum which was launched in January 2023.

Before joining CEEW, he worked with the International Water Management Institute (IWMI) and the Institute for Resource Analysis and Policy. He has been engaged as a specialist in projects, research studies, and assignments supported by various national and international organisations including the European Commission, World Bank, GIZ, DFID, WRG 2030/IFC, UNICEF, WWF, IWMI, Fresh-Thoughts Consulting, DBT, SRTT, and SDTT.

He is a Natural Resource Management Specialist (M. Phil, M. Sc.) with more than 100 publications to his credit. He has co-edited five books, two of which were published by Routledge UK, two by Springer Nature, Switzerland, and one by Sage Publications. He regularly reviews manuscripts for Water Policy, International Journal of Water Resources Development, Journal of Hydrology, and book proposals for Routledge, Sage, Springer, and Wiley.

speakers.Name: Mr. S.M. Vijayanand
speakers.Bio: Mr. Vijayanand is an officer of the 1981 batch of the IAS, belonging to the Kerala cadre. Almost his entire career was in Rural Development, Local Governance, and Decentralized Planning. He coordinated Kerala's People's Planning for fifteen years. During this period he nurtured Kudumbashree, a highly successful SHG programme in the country and was active in moulding the Kerala Institute of Local Administration (KILA) into an institution of excellence in the training of Elected Representatives. As Secretary of the Ministry of Panchayati Raj during 2015-16, he was instrumental in introducing the Gram Panchayat Development Plan (GPDP) in the country.

speakers.Name: Ms. Aparna Dua
speakers.Bio:
Aparna Dua is a Partner at The Blended Finance Company (TBFC), where she has played a pivotal role in designing and launching the ASPYRE facility, which enables students from low-income households to access skill loans for aspirational skilling courses. She has also led the design of blended finance and outcomes-based structures to scale climate-smart agriculture for smallholder farmers.

Before co-founding TBFC, Aparna headed the think tank at Asha Impact, where she established the organisation’s blended finance practice, including designing India’s first Social Impact Bond and other innovative structures in livelihoods. Under her leadership, Asha emerged as a leading voice in outcomes-based financing (OBF), driving national dialogues on the Social Stock Exchange and advocating for CSR funds for OBF in partnership with UNDP, USAID, and other industry bodies. She co-authored influential reports on impact investing and blended finance in India, and has been a consistent advocate for mobilising more capital into the space. Aparna has also consulted for the Delhi Government on setting up the State Skilling and Entrepreneurship University, and helped establish Innovation Mission Punjab, a public–private partnership with the Punjab Government to strengthen the state’s entrepreneurship ecosystem.

Earlier in her career, Aparna was with the Boston Consulting Group, working across sectors to improve development outcomes, particularly in education. She serves on the Advisory Council at the Centre for Innovative Finance at ISDM and on the Investment Committee for the Startup India Seed Fund at the Indian School of Business. She has been part of the Impact Investors Council’s Blended Finance Committee and served as co-chair of the ANDE India Lab on SGB Finance.

Aparna began her career on Wall Street as an investment banker at Credit Suisse. She holds an MBA from INSEAD and a BA in Mathematics and Economics from Carleton College.

speakers.Name: Ms. Bijal Brahmbhatt
speakers.Bio:
Bijal has extensive experience in, and broad knowledge of intersectional challenges that are mediated through housing and habitat, governance (lack there-of), informality, and gender for low-income urban communities and migrants in cities. She represents and advocates for the rights to improve living conditions, foster climate resilience and overall economic security, through socio-technical approaches and women-led models, never to miss important opportunities, advocate across multiple scales, and break silos.  

Her work of over 20 years in cities can be best summed up to be in the areas of formal, informal, and invisible governance for housing and habitat—an amalgam of individual/ household/ community and city-level activities; strategies through which women can seek public goods and services central to their well-being; voice and agency essential for making claims on the state and spaces for participation (social capital),  all of which happen outside of the gaze of formalized governance arrangements. Her programmes have helped women participate in city-level initiatives, a small step to make cities inclusive. She constantly engages with markets for pro-poor solutions, and with policymakers to solicit not just marginal improvements but driving system-level changes.

Bijal is a Fellow (2015) of the Womanity Foundation, Switzerland; a finalist of Schwab Foundation’s Social Entrepreneur of the year, India. She was awarded the Surya Mitra National Award for creating sustainable energy assets for equitable access in Urban Areas by the Selco Foundation.

She is a member of the InsuResilience Gender Working Group  of the InsuResilience Global Partnership which works towards gender-sensitive Climate and Disaster Risk Finance and Insurance solutions and she has contributed to the InsuResilience Global Partnership Declaration on Gender.

speakers.Name: Ms. Jane Nabunnya Mulumba
speakers.Organization: IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre, Uganda
speakers.Bio:
Jane Nabunnya Mulumba is a Ugandan female leader with over 19 years of experience advancing sustainable water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) systems, climate-resilient water resources management, and gender-inclusive development across Uganda and the East African region.                                                                                                                                                                                                                    She holds a Master of Public Health Leadership (Uganda Christian University), an MSc in Public Policy and Management (University of London), an MA in Communication (Daystar University), and a BA in Arts (Makerere University).

Since 2013, Jane has served as Country Director for IRC Uganda, leading national policy engagement, systems strengthening, multi-stakeholder coordination, and resource mobilization. Her leadership has transformed programs from project-based approaches to sustainable systems, integrating climate resilience, gender equality, and social inclusion into WASH governance, policy, and financing frameworks. 

Previously, she worked with the Nile Basin Initiative, WSSCC, IRC Triple-S Project, and DENIVA, building expertise in stakeholder engagement, decentralization, and civil society strengthening.

Jane chairs the Uganda Water and Sanitation Network (UWASNET), represents IRC on the Water Integrity Network Supervisory (WIN) Board, and serves on multiple national and regional boards and committees. She is recognized for her strategic leadership, innovation, advocacy, and commitment to climate-resilient, gender-responsive, and sustainable WASH and water systems that deliver lasting impact for communities.

speakers.Name: Ms. Manvita Baradi
speakers.Bio: Manvita Baradi has over 25 years of technical experience in developing and administering programs to local governments in the areas of service delivery, local governance, urban planning, heritage management, citizen participation, capacity building of local government associations, development of urban indicators and performance measurement and international development. She has served as Director-South Asia for the International City/County Management Association (ICMA), been technical consultant for United Agency for International Development (USAID) and served as an expert on World Bank funded programs for local governance, association development and urban planning programs in post-conflict regions like Afghanistan, Indonesia and Sri Lanka. In her role as director of UMC, she provides expert guidance to the various projects undertaken by the organisation. She is the Gujarat State Convener of Indian National Trust of Art and Cultural Heritage (INTACH). Manvita is an alumni of the senior executive institute, Darden Business School, University of Virginia, USA. And has done a summer course for local government management from University of Illinois, USA. Manvita is passionate about theatre and is a renowned name in Gujarati theatre. She has been actively involved in developmental communication using street theatre as an effective medium for communication. She has guided over half a dozen video productions on urban issues. She effectively uses her knowledge of city planning, design and theatre to work with people across age groups and knowledge skills. Manvita also serves as the Dean of School of Habitat Management at CEPT University. manvita@umcasia.org

speakers.Name: Ms. Meenakshi Arora
speakers.Bio:
Prof Meenakshi Arora is Professor in the Department of Infrastructure Engineering at The University of Melbourne, Associate Dean for graduate Research at the Faculty of Engineering and IT and served as Director of Melbourne India Postgraduate Academy (MIPA) 2015-24. Her main research interests are water quality (surface water, groundwater and stormwater), contaminant transport modelling and groundwater remediation. She has close collaboration with Victorian water authorities such as Melbourne Water, Yarra Valley Water, Southeast Water, councils and several industries.  

Prof. Arora has received awards for her leadership and groundbreaking research including Women in Water Leadership Award, Excellence Award for Internationalisation of Research, Australia India Impact Award and Victoria Fellowship for innovative research in Physical Sciences. She leads several national and international projects funded by government and industry. 

She has developed a cost-effective groundwater treatment plant to provide safe drinking water to the rural communities in Rajasthan India and has served on NHMRC's 'Fluoride Reference Group' panel to advise on the fluoridation of drinking water in Australia. Recently, she received a funding grant from the Australia India Institute to support the fieldwork necessary for understanding the extent of the groundwater contamination issue in India, and funding from Liquid I.V. to research low-cost methods to remove harmful groundwater contaminants that affect drinking water in rural communities in India. 

Dr. Arora has chaired several international conferences including 'Practical Responses to Climate Change' and four Melbourne India Postgraduate Conferences. She has published widely in high impact journals and delivered keynote addresses in various international conferences. She serves as a member of editorial boards as well as reviewers for various journals of high repute.  

Full profile and project highlights: https://findanexpert.unimelb.edu.au/profile/187191-meenakshi-arora

speakers.Name: Ms. Nafisa Barot
speakers.Designation: Former Executive Director, Founder and Advisor
speakers.Bio: With four decades of experience in building and capacitating gender sensitive institutions for the empowerment of rural marginalized communities, Nafisa Barot is actively associated with the women’s and other people’s movements, influencing people and policies around water, gender justice and sustainable development. The desolate Bhal region of coastal Gujarat, where she along with three other women persevered to understand what options communities might have for development and hope, provided Nafisa with her real learning. Efforts in identifying and working with local women with a potential for leadership and with stamina to face the physical, social and environmental barriers to change, led them to co found Utthan in 1981. Today, Utthan has established its identity as an organization which has successfully demonstrated socio-technological alternatives that address the issues of the most marginalised. Nafisa has served on Government task forces of CAPART, NABARD, DWACRA, Planning Commission amongst a few. She is a founder Board member of several organisations and forums including Mahiti, Development Support Centre, Pravah and Working Group for Women & Land Ownership and India Wash Forum. She is currently on the Steering Committees of Water Conflict Forum and Mahila Kisan Adhikar Manch. She has published several articles on gender/water governance and community agency and been invited to speak at national and international forums.

speakers.Name: Ms. Neha Kumar
speakers.Organization: South Asia, Climate Bonds Initiative, India
speakers.Bio: Neha Kumar is the Head, South Asia, Climate Bonds Initiative and is based in Delhi. She steers policy, strategy and partnerships on climate risks and sustainable financial ecosystem in the region. Her efforts are targeted at building policy mechanisms, market infrastructure and capacities needed to accelerate financing for green, just and resilient transition. Her current areas of focus include transition and resilence finance, the role of financial policy and regulation, and DFIs and MDBs. Avidly interested in the political economy of flow of sustainable finance, she has been working on the topics of equity and climate justice. She has over twenty two years of experience in responsible financing, environmental and socio-political risks, serves on several policy and regulatory committees on climate finance and taxonomy. She is trained in science, international environmental negotiations and politics.

speakers.Name: Prof Hamanth Kasan
speakers.Organization: The International Water Association, South Africa
speakers.Bio:
Prof Kasan acquired a unique blend of educational qualifications which include science, engineering, management, leadership, corporate governance and is a certified neuro semantic coach. He also has had the benefit of working in both the academic and utility sectors with over 30 years of experience. He established the Institute of Water and Wastewater Research some 25 years ago at Durban University of Technology which has grown from strength to strength and produces world class research and training for postgraduate students for the water and sanitation sector. As founder he serves as Honorary Professor of the Institute. He also served as Dean of the Faculty of Applied sciences at the University.
Prof Kasan served Rand Water as General Manager of Scientific Services for 22 years, responsible for the technology, innovation, research and optimisation aspects of water treatment, and public health of 16 million consumers by provision of world class quality water.  During this period, he transformed operations to world class standard which was recognised and respected by the global community of water professionals. 
As a global leader in water and sanitation, he has held and continues to hold many leadership positions, locally, continentally and globally. Some of the leadership positions include, Board Chair, Water Research Commission, Ministerial Advisor to Prof Kader Asmal and Ronnie Kasrils, Board member, Umgeni Water, Senior Fellow of the Water Institute of Southern Africa, Distinguished Fellow of the International Water Association, Fellow of the Institute of Directors, Board Member of the International Water Association (IWA), Vice President of IWA, Chair of IWA Board Committee on Governance,  Board Member of the African Water and Sanitation Association(AFWASA), Vice President of AFWASA, Chair of Board Committee of AFWASA Strategic Capacity Building Committee, Advisory Board Member of The UN  Habitat  Global Water Operators Partnership (GWOPA) programme, Member of International Programme Committee, Singapore International Water Week, and, Member of Steering Committee of the South African Water Chamber. Prof Kasan has also served and continues to serve as Non-Executive Director of various Boards. 
He is currently the President of the International Water Association, and Chairperson of the Board of Directors, which is the foremost global water and sanitation association of water professionals with over 9 000 professional members from over 100 countries. He was recently re-elected as President through overwhelming support of the IWA General Assembly comprised of member representatives from 70 countries. He has developed an extensive network across the world and is highly respected in the fraternity for innovative approaches and masterful execution to realise impact and value. He is also an independent advisor.

speakers.Name: Abhranil Munsi
speakers.Bio: Abhranil Munsi is a Project Associate at the Urban Management Centre where he's working towards improving the safety and dignity of sanitation workers across India by leveraging a systems change approach. An urban planner from CEPT University with a background in Architecture, he is passionate about leveraging urban data analytics into improving cities, livelihoods and infrastructure.

speakers.Name: Akshay SR
speakers.Designation: Post graduate student in Environmental Design
speakers.Bio: I am Ar. Akshay S R, currently pursuing a Master’s in Environmental Design at the College of Engineering, Trivandrum. I completed my Bachelor of Architecture from Mahatma Gandhi University, where my academic journey strengthened my interest in sustainability and context-driven design. I am particularly passionate about sustainable architecture, river rejuvenation, and environmentally responsive urban systems. In 2022, I was shortlisted for the Council of Architecture (CoA) Thesis Award for my undergraduate thesis titled “Architectural Amelioration of the Mullaperiyar Dam,” which explored the intersection of infrastructure, ecology, and regional resilience through architectural intervention.

speakers.Name: Alokananda Bisoyi
speakers.Bio: Mr. Alokananda Bisoyi is an M&E, health, and policy researcher with eight years of experience working on WASH innovations and rural water governance. He is currently an International Innovation Corps (IIC) Fellow with the Development Innovation Lab (DIL), focusing on service reliability, digital monitoring tools, and community-led water management. He previously worked with Emory University, USA, leading large-scale RCTSs, monitoring systems, and behaviour-driven programme design. His work spans greywater reuse, decentralised treatment solutions, and evidence-based health interventions in Odisha and Telangana. Alokananda holds an Executive MPH from IIHMR and a BA in Social Sciences from TISS Hyderabad.

speakers.Name: Amogh Coca
speakers.Bio: Hello, I'm Amogh Coca, a second year student at CEPT University studying Civil Engineering. Im am extremely interested and passionate about water resources, management and design and am always eager to learn and do more in the subject matter.

speakers.Name: Celestin Defo
speakers.Organization: Higher Institute of Agriculture, Forestry, Water and Environment, University of Ebolowa, Cameroon.
speakers.Bio: Prof Celestin Defo received the MSc in water engineering from the University of Dschang in Cameroon in 2006 and a Ph. D in water science and technology in 2016 at the Indian Agricultural Research Institute, New Delhi, India after being selected as Mwalimu Nyerere African Union Fellow. In 2010, he was recruited as an Assistant Lecturer at the School of Wood, Water and Natural Resources, Faculty of Agronomy and Agricultural Science, Ebolowa Branch of the University of Dschang and he is presently, Associate Professor at the University of Ebolowa, Cameroon. He is the author of more than fourty (40) articles published in peer review journals. He has contributed for more than 20 national and international conferences. Since 2021, he is also part time Lecturer at the International Institute for Water and Environmental Engineering (2IE) at Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso. Besides, he is short term Lecturer at the Pan-African University PAUWES-Institute for Water and Energy Sciences at Tlemcen, Algeria, since 2022. At the University of Ebolowa, he is the Deputy Coordinator of the International Masters in Non Sewered Sanitation, in cooperation with 2IE Ouagadougou and IHE DELFT, The Netherlands. His research interests cover several aspects across water engineering (water supply, water pollution, wastewater recycling and computer application).

speakers.Name: Chanda Mulundu
speakers.Organization: Lusaka Water Supply and Sanitation Company

speakers.Name: Christian Gessl
speakers.Organization: Support of Innovations in Agriculture and Development of innovative Technologies Fund Public Association (Agroinnovatsiya, Uzbekistan)
speakers.Bio: Christian Gessl is an economic development expert with extensive experience designing and leading capacity-building initiatives across Central Asia, with a recent focus on water diplomacy, climate resilience, and community-based environmental governance. Within the Engage H2O programme, he contributes to strengthening youth-led water awareness and participatory water management by connecting scientific insights on climate risks and glacier loss with practical, community-driven action. His work supports the integration of ecosystem restoration, gender-sensitive approaches, and cross-border dialogue into local water governance structures. Drawing on decades of experience in value-chain development, public-private dialogue, and regional cooperation, Christian brings a unique perspective on how water can serve as a driver of peace, trust, and sustainable development. He has collaborated with universities, civil society organisations, and local authorities to encourage evidence-based water solutions that empower youth and promote resilience in vulnerable regions of Central Asia.

speakers.Name: Dixita Pariaker
speakers.Bio:
Dixita Pariaker is trained as an architect and has around three years of experience working at the intersection of sanitation and informality. An alumna of the Regulatory Policy and Governance programme at the Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai, her master’s research examined the impacts of solid waste management policies in Surat on informal waste pickers and their livelihoods.
She has been involved in on-the-ground solid waste management work in Surat, engaging closely with waste collectors and waste pickers to address operational and livelihood concerns. She has also worked as part of a Technical Support Unit, contributing to national and state sanitation initiatives focused on the safety, recognition, and inclusion of sanitation workers and waste pickers.
She is currently associated with VIKAS Centre for Development, where she supports research and programme design across community-led initiatives. Her interests lie in solid waste management, informality and enterprise-based livelihood opportunities through waste.

speakers.Name: Dr. Danley Colecraft Aidoo
speakers.Bio: Danley Colecraft Aidoo is a Lecturer in the Department of Agricultural Extension at the University of Ghana. His research focuses on climate adaptation, accountability in development interventions, and sustainable rural livelihoods, with particular attention to farming communities in Sub-Saharan Africa. He has worked on issues relating to agricultural extension, development communication, and participatory governance in climate and rural development programmes. Danley is currently involved in research examining how accountability mechanisms shape the effectiveness of climate adaptation projects at the community level. His work seeks to bridge academic research and practice by strengthening local participation and institutional responsiveness in development initiatives.

speakers.Name: Injaya Kumar Manandhar
speakers.Organization: Nepal Bureau of Standards and Metrology

speakers.Name: Joseph Tuntepe
speakers.Designation: Independent WASH Researcher & Community WASH Volunteer
speakers.Bio:
Joseph Tuntepe is a WASH Specialist and emerging researcher with over 12 years of professional experience dedicated to strengthening water, sanitation, and hygiene systems in Zambia.
His extensive background covers utility operations (Nkana Water and Sewerage Company), sanitation project implementation, and large-scale infrastructure improvement, including his role as Building Superintendent at Zambia Sugar Plc.
Currently, Joseph is advancing his research on climate-resilient WASH systems, focusing on the critical intersection of hydro-climatic risks, urban sanitation, and public health. His current study, “The Hydro-Climatic-Sanitation Nexus: Assessing the Impact of Urban Flooding on Faecal Sludge Management and Diarrheal Disease Risk in Mazabuka, Zambia,”.
Joseph's work is driven by a passion for evidence-based solutions that improve institutional coordination, enhance service delivery, and build resilience in rapidly growing urban areas. He is committed to strengthening faecal sludge management and promoting climate-resilient sanitation to protect vulnerable communities.

speakers.Name: Kapil Dhabu
speakers.Organization: International Innovation Corps, University of Chicago Trust
speakers.Bio: Kapil is a public policy professional working at the intersection of technology, natural resources, people, and climate. As a fellow with the International Innovation Corps (University of Chicago Trust), he works on policy research initiatives focused on sustainability and governance. Leveraging data insights and research, he integrates innovative and systemic approaches, drawing on his interests in governance, sustainability, geopolitics, and economic and legal discourses to deliver impactful solutions.

speakers.Name: Kartikee Mahadik
speakers.Bio:
Kartikee Mahadik is a third-year Civil Engineering student at CEPT University who enjoys learning by building, testing, and reworking ideas. She is interested in applying technical knowledge to real-world scenarios and likes solving problems by designing systems, working with physical infrastructure, and exploring unconventional ideas.
Her work includes a climate-responsive shelter proposal for the Thar Desert, inspired by the passive cooling strategies observed in termite mounds, and 'SplashNet', a project that explores secure, offline communication through a building’s water pipeline network using controlled hydraulic flow instead of digital systems. Outside academics, Kartikee engages with performing arts and values curiosity, creativity, and interdisciplinary exploration.

speakers.Name: Maaz Imran Multani
speakers.Organization: Institute of Design Planning & Technology (IDPT), Surat
speakers.Bio:
Maaz Imran Multani is a final-year architecture student at the Faculty of Architecture, Institute of Design Planning and Technology, Surat. His academic work reflects a clear interest in detail-oriented design, cultural documentation, and the social dimensions of the built environment. He has developed a focused approach to understanding vernacular contexts and community-oriented spatial practices, which continues to shape his research and design direction.
Alongside his academic pursuits, Maaz has represented his institution at national platforms such as NASA India, COA competitions, and national heritage awards. Through these engagements, he has contributed to teams that received major distinctions, including the Le Corbusier Trophy at the national level.
He has also undertaken extensive study tours across India, documenting settlements, institutions, and cultural landscapes to deepen his understanding of architectural contexts. Maaz aims to contribute to a design practice that is innovative, human-centric, and strongly responsive to cultural and environmental settings.

speakers.Name: Mahi Patel
speakers.Bio: Mahi Patel is a PhD research scholar in Physics at Silver Oak University, Ahmedabad. Her research focuses on remote sensing and geospatial analysis for urban environmental studies, including land surface temperature, surface energy balance, urban climate, and environmental stress assessment. She works extensively with satellite and ground-based datasets using tools such as Google Earth Engine (GEE), QGIS, ArcGIS, and Python. Her academic background includes a B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Physics, and she has hands-on research experience through training and internship at SAC–ISRO. Her current interests include integrating atmospheric composition and air quality analysis with urban climate studies to support sustainable urban planning.

speakers.Name: Malon Muronzi
speakers.Bio:
My name is Malon Muronzi from Zimbabwe a holder of a degree in Geography and Disaster
Management from the Catholic University of Zimbabwe; I have built a strong foundation in
addressing climate-related issues. I have certificates in climate change, human rights, refugee
rights, water rights, migrant rights, carbon credits, and ecological justice advocacy demonstrate
your commitment to this field. My experience in climate justice is further highlighted by my
participation in international climate change conferences and workshops such as COP 29,
Africa Climate Summit, Caravan of Hope.I am the director of Young Climate Activism in
Zimbabwe .My active engagement in these events has likely provided valuable insights and
networking opportunities.My work aligns with the principles of Laudato Si, and I have
dedicated my time advocating for ecological justice. I expertise and passion in making
meaningful impact in addressing climate-related challenges. I have been working on water
security related issues such as water security and gender based violence around peri urban areas
and rural communities

speakers.Name: Mathews Mwela Chansa
speakers.Bio:
Mathews Mwela Chansa is a Registered Environmental Engineer with speciality in both
sewered and non-sewered sanitation, solid waste and project Management. He has 20 years of
work experience in Environmental health and Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH)
sectors - having previously worked as an Environment Health Technologist (EHT) under the
Ministry of Health and WASH Officer at the Catholic Medical Mission Board Zambia. He is
a member of the International Water Association (IWA) and Engineering Institution of
Zambia (EIZ). A recent graduate from IHE Delft Institute for Water Education, Delft, the
Netherlands, with a MSc in Water and Sustainable Development (Sanitation), Eng. Chansa
occasionally provides consultancy WASH services to Capacity Development Enterprise
(CADEV), a locally based Zambian registered Non-governmental Organization. He is
actively looking for PhD opportunities with a bias towards resource recovery from
wastewater.

speakers.Name: Meghna Malhotra
speakers.Bio:
Meghna Malhotra is the Deputy Director of Urban Management Centre. She is an expert on the design and operation of human centric infrastructure. With over two decades of experience, Meghna stands at the forefront of advocating for the safety, dignity, and well-being of sanitation workers, as highlighted by her leadership in the implementation of the National Action for Mechanised Sanitation Ecosystem (NAMASTE) Scheme, Garima scheme and other significant projects.
She is instrumental to UMC’s comprehensive support to the Deendayal Antyoday Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM). Meghna has facilitated an emphasis on convergence between DAY-NULM, Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) and other flagship missions.
Since 2001, Meghna, a CEPT University visiting faculty with a master's in Environmental Planning, manages city-to-city programs fostering peer learning. Her holistic approach to local development is evident through courses she developed, reaching government officials in 200+ cities, showcasing her impactful contribution to urban collaboration and education.

speakers.Name: Mendy Zibuyile Shozi
speakers.Organization: Bremen Overseas Research and Development Association (BORDA) South Africa

speakers.Name: Ms. Sradha Das
speakers.Bio:
Sradha Das is a development professional with over 12 years of experience in the social sector, working across public health, nutrition, and Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) programs. She holds a Post Graduate in Rural Management from KIIT University, Odisha, and has been actively involved in designing, implementing and monitoring community-centric interventions with a focus on resilience, sustainability, and equity.
Currently based in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, she works closely with government systems and communities to strengthen climate-resilient WASH infrastructures. Her work reflects a strong grounding in field realities and lived experiences of vulnerable communities.
Outside of work, she values creativity and balance in everyday life and enjoys spending time at home where painting and cooking are shared interests within her family.

speakers.Name: Namagembe Masitullah
speakers.Bio:
Masitullah Namagembe is a Grants and Research Assistant at the African Field Epidemiology Network (AFENET), where she blends her passion for community health with a strong commitment to evidence-based impact. Her journey into public health and development is shaped by lived experiences and a desire to support solutions that uplift vulnerable populations. She finds meaning in bringing together researchers, communities, and policymakers to co-create stronger, more resilient systems.
Alongside her role at AFENET, Masitullah consults with WaterConsults, providing subject matter expertise in business development on public health issues such as water security, sanitation, and climate resilience across Africa and the broader Global South. Working across sectors has deepened her belief in interdisciplinary collaboration as a key driver of meaningful change.
Driven by curiosity, empathy, and purpose, Masitullah hopes her work continues to foster shared learning, impactful partnerships, and community-centered solutions that strengthen both health and resilience.

speakers.Name: Nana Kobea Bonso
speakers.Organization: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

speakers.Name: Navya Mistry
speakers.Bio:
I am a Youth Researcher at Jalchakra Innovations LLP, working at the intersection of water restoration, environmental sustainability, and nature-based solutions. I actively contribute to scientific research, field documentation, and policy-oriented studies focused on waterbody rejuvenation, soil health improvement, and ecosystem revival through innovative indigenous nature based technologies.
I have been involved in developing case studies, technical notes, and research-backed communication for Jalchakra’s government programs such as AMRUT 2.0, while also supporting international and national representations of Jalchakra Innovations at environmental forums and knowledge platforms. My work reflects a strong integration of science, sustainability, and societal impact.
My latest publication in Swadeshi Vigyan Patrika highlights indigenous, science-driven approaches to water and ecological restoration, reinforcing my commitment to evidence-based solutions rooted in Indian knowledge systems. I continue to work towards bridging research, on-ground implementation, and policy discourse for a sustainable future.

speakers.Name: Oromitu Tufa Kabeto
speakers.Organization: Nagele Arsii Water Resource and Energy bureau

speakers.Name: Priyansh Singh
speakers.Bio: Priyansh Singh is a second-year student pursuing Bachelor's in Civil Engineering at CEPT University, Ahmedabad. He has a keen interest in researching and implementing smart automation methods and strategies to increase operational efficiency and real-time monitoring capabilities in systems. He has worked on projects addressing real world challenges by introducing scalable solutions that offer effective alternatives to manual operations, while reducing maintenance requirements and operational hazards. One of his notable works includes an algorithm which is capable of detecting leakage regions in a pipe network using only outlet flow sensors, along with an alert system, which is scalable at a smaller as well as larger scale, providing a smart solution to detect pipe leakage in the water network. His aim is to propose innovative methods that replace the old methods by implementing automation in civil engineering.

speakers.Name: Prof. Kuldeepsinh Jadeja
speakers.Organization: Institute of Design, Planning & Technology, Sarvajanik University, Surat

speakers.Name: Rajas Kolhatkar
speakers.Bio: Rajas Kolhatkar is a public policy professional working at the intersection of water quality, community engagement, and public systems. He is a Fellow with the International Innovation Corps (IIC), placed with the Development Innovation Lab (DIL-India) at the University of Chicago, where he supports implementation-focused work on in-line chlorination and rural water safety. He brings a governance lens to program design and delivery, working with government counterparts and community institutions to translate field realities into practical, scalable approaches. His interests include equity in service delivery, frontline systems, and institutional reform.

speakers.Name: Sagar Patil
speakers.Organization: All India Institute of Local Self Government, Mumbai
speakers.Bio:
Mr. Sagar Patil holds a Master’s in Technology in Civil - Environmental Engineering and works as the Senior Technical Officer at AIILSG, Mumbai. With over 11 years of experience in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG), his expertise spans faecal sludge management (FSM), used water (wastewater) management and solid waste management.
He has worked extensively with government, private, NGO, and CSR stakeholders on advocacy, planning, technical design, management, and implementation of waste management projects. As a skilled capacity builder, he has organized and conducted training programs for government and private officials/engineers on used water management, FSM, and occupational health and safety. Additionally, he has been involved in research projects focused on faecal sludge treatment and wastewater management. He deeply understands government policies, guidelines, and missions in the WASH sector.

speakers.Name: Saidou Djibo Mahamane Moustapha
speakers.Organization: NGO Facilitation of National and Cross-Border Transhumance for Pastoralists (FAT-TRANS-BIGGAL)
speakers.Bio: Saidou Djibo Mahamane Moustapha is a committed leader and the President of the NGO FAT-TRANS-BIGGAL, where he works to protect pastoralists, support secure transhumance, and strengthen rural communities living in insecure areas. With more than 12 years of experience in communication, project coordination, and community mobilization, he has also served as Communication Advisor with JSI. Trained as a socio-anthropologist, he conducts research on access to drinking water and sanitation in rural areas. Passionate about local development, peacebuilding, and resilience, he uses his expertise to improve the living conditions of vulnerable populations across Niger.

speakers.Name: Sangita Bose Das
speakers.Organization: Hooghly Chinchurah Municipality, (UD & MA Dept. West Bengal)
speakers.Bio:
Sangita Bose Das is an Urban Planner at Hooghly-Chinsurah Municipality, West Bengal with over 17 years of professional experience in urban infrastructure and municipal services. She holds a Master’s degree in Geography from Chhatrapati Shahu Ji Maharaj University. She has done course on Urban Management from IIT Kharagpur and Urban Planning and Management from the University of Calcutta.
Her professional work involves planning and implementation of urban development projects, particularly in housing, land-use planning, basic urban services, and solid waste management. She focuses on addressing field-level challenges and ensuring effective implementation of government policies at the municipal level. She has actively engaged in project monitoring, coordination and policy implementation at the municipal level. 
She has undergone multiple professional training programmes at the Administrative Training Institute (ATI), Government of West Bengal. Her areas of interest include sustainable urban development, participatory planning, and inclusive urban governance.

speakers.Name: Saurabh Kumar
speakers.Organization: Department of Botany, Aligarh Muslim University
speakers.Bio: I, Saurabh Kumar currently enrolled in Ph.D. program at the Department of Botany, Aligarh Muslim University, Aligarh. I did B.Sc. in Botany and Zoology, M.Sc. in Botany with specialization in Environmental Botany and in Ph.D. my specialization is also Environmental Botany. I also worked in a DRDO project entitled as project “AVaNi” and besides it I also attended many trainings, workshops and conferences as well. My present research focuses on identifying the uptake and accumulation of heavy metals in crop plant treated with varying concentration of sewage water. Beyond research, I believe in inclusivity and diversity and working for gender rights and equality. I like travelling, cooking, listening music, reading books, nature, trees, mountains and love to connect with like minded educated people. In future, I want to work as a environmentalist in a good repute organization.

speakers.Name: Shruthi Gurumoorthy
speakers.Bio: Shruthi Gurumoorthy is a development professional and has completed her graduation and post-graduation in Social Work from the University of Delhi and Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai. She has worked with NGOs, and policy think tanks and has been part of a reputed Delhi Government Fellowship. Her interests include caste and gender.

speakers.Name: Tanay Chopra
speakers.Bio: Tanay Chopra is an urban designer from CEPT University, Ahmedabad, and is currently working as a Junior Urban Designer at Metabolic Office, Ahmedabad. His academic work has focused on climate change challenges, particularly heat and flooding. His co-authored research paper, “Assessment of Co-Benefits of Water Bodies in India,” integrates ecological, social, and spatial parameters supported by GIS-based analysis and examines water bodies across different ownership and governance frameworks. He has previously interned at BDP India and has also co-authored a research paper accepted by AESOP and the University of Toronto. His broader interests lie at the intersection of urban policy and climate adaptation

speakers.Name: Tania Thankam Mathew
speakers.Bio: I am a Master of Planning Student with a background in engineering, specializing in housing. My dissertation work focuses on resilient WASH solutions by examining sanitation challenges in coastal and flood-prone regions, with specific reference to zoning patterns along the Kerala Coast. Then assesses decentralized and climate responsive sanitation systems based on risk-sensitive zoning and land-use characteristics. The work forms the basis for continued thesis research towards developing a zoning based resilient sanitation framework for vulnerable coastal areas.

speakers.Name: Theogene Rusatira
speakers.Organization: Movimento Lotta alla Fame nel Mondo

speakers.Name: Yogesh Nerpagar
speakers.Organization:
Center for
youth development
and activities

speakers.Name: Alejandro Jimenez
speakers.Bio: “Dr. Jiménez leads the WASH Governance Group at IVL Swedish Environmental Research Institute, a multidisciplinary team of experts based across three continents. With over 20 years of experience, he has led global water governance programs in more than 70 countries, developed and applied tools for multistakeholder governance processes, and conducted applied research. His work has resulted in over 65 peer-reviewed articles and book chapters, with a particular focus on the human rights to water and sanitation, water governance, and resilience. Prior to joining IVL, Dr. Jiménez served as department director at the Stockholm International Water Institute (SIWI) and has also worked in the private sector, non-governmental organizations, academia, and as an independent consultant.”

speakers.Name: Anjali Wagle K
speakers.Bio:
Anjali is an environmental engineer currently serving as Assistant Manager – Integrated Water Management at Technology Informatics Design Endeavour (TIDE NGO). She brings experience across WASH and climate change initiatives, with a strong grounding in sustainable practices. Her work focuses on capacity building and translating environmental knowledge into practical, implementable solutions. With a multidisciplinary perspective, Anjali is committed to addressing complex environmental challenges through holistic and innovative approaches. She is motivated to deepen her expertise in ESG, sustainability, and climate resilient systems, while contributing to projects that create long-term environmental and social impact. 
Outside her professional work, she enjoys travel, content creation and creative writing, which complement her analytical mindset with creativity.

speakers.Name: Ansu Susan Cherian
speakers.Bio:
Ansu Susan Cherian is an urban planning and policy professional with 12+ years of experience working at the intersection of water, climate resilience, and urban governance. As Lead – Integrated Water Management at BORDA South Asia, she drives research and implementation of circular, decentralised, and climate-responsive water systems, with a strong focus on small and emerging towns.
Her work bridges research, policy, and on-ground practice, helping translate sustainability goals into practical, scalable solutions. Passionate about community-centred and evidence-driven approaches, Ansu collaborates closely with governments, development partners, and local stakeholders. She is particularly interested in positioning small towns as critical frontlines for equitable, inclusive, and climate-resilient water transformation across South Asia.

speakers.Name: Anurag Anthony
speakers.Bio:
Anurag Anthony has 15 years’ experience of working in association with local governments. His key areas of expertise include statutory master plans, sanitation, transport and heritage. Anurag has contributed in various capacities for preparation of city sanitation plans, SWM Master Plans and DPRs, heritage documentation and management, urban design plans, municipal data management and improvement studies, urban poverty schemes, policies under the Swachh Bharat Mission and industrial area planning.
Anurag has academic exposure and professional experience in India, USA, UK, Italy, Pakistan and Libya. A graduate in Architecture, Anurag has a Master’s degree in Architecture (Urban Design), MSc in International Trade & Transport, London, MBA in International Business, Pondicherry and is currently pursuing Environmental Law from NLSUI Bangalore.

speakers.Name: Archana Goswami
speakers.Bio:
A committed environmental planner and engineer with over 15 years of experience across government, private consulting, and academia. Archana has led environmental planning, safeguards, and impact assessments for major infrastructure projects, including those funded by international institutions.
Notably, she served as Environmental Safeguards Specialist and Senior Planner for the Ahmedabad Metro Rail project, handling process documentation, research on land acquisition, resettlement, and rehabilitation. Her field expertise shines through coordinating urban and rural surveys across diverse geographies.
She has authored, edited, and compiled key project reports, and is the lead author of Climate Vulnerabilities of the Natural Resource Dependent Communities of Kachchh, Gujarat (GEER Foundation & GIDR).

speakers.Name: Basil Agoha
speakers.Organization: Chukwemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu University Anambra State Nigeria
speakers.Bio: Associate  Professor of Architecture, PhD in Architecture specializing in Urban  Design, former Associate Dean, Faculty of Environmental Sciences and Department of Architecture, Fellow Nigerian Institute of Architects, member, (NIA) Architects Registration Council of Nigeria, (ARCON). Presented papers in local and international conferences and Session Chair for International Union of Architects’ conferences (UIA) in congresses in Durban South Africa in 2014 and  Seoul South  Korea in 2017. A Fellow of Nigerian Institute of Architects, Architects Registration Council of  Nigeria, External Examiner and Juror to Universities. Chairman Board of Trustee, (BoT) for community development  Non-Governmental Organisations (NGOs); Home Owners-Occupiers Association, and Community & Neighbourhood Development Initiative. Researches span through urban design, traditional open spaces and community architecture, correspondent member International Union of Architects, (UIA) Education Commission Validation Board and Heritage and Cultural Identity (HCI), Work Group. Has  proficiency certificates in Artificial Intelligence, Grant Writing proposal and Cyber security.

speakers.Name: Benny Filumba
speakers.Bio: Benny Filumba is a WASH and public health practitioner based in Lusaka, Zambia, with experience in sanitation systems strengthening, community engagement, and knowledge management. He currently works as a Project Assistant with CaDev Catalyst Development, supporting the implementation of urban and community-based WASH initiatives, including field coordination, data collection, reporting, and stakeholder engagement. Benny also serves as a Forum Moderator with the Sustainable Sanitation Alliance (SuSanA), facilitating global knowledge exchange and curating technical content on sanitation and hygiene. His professional interests focus on inclusive WASH governance and financing pathways, behaviour change, and climate-resilient sanitation systems, with particular emphasis on underserved urban communities.

speakers.Name: Dr. Anujkumar Ghorpade
speakers.Bio:
Dr. Anujkumar Ghorpade began his journey as a civil engineer, graduating from  Kolhapur, India, in 2011. He started as a site engineer in Himachal Pradesh, leading railway construction in a challenging terrain. To broaden his expertise, he earned a master’s from SVNIT Surat, India, and later worked at Larsen & Toubro, Mumbai, India.
Fuelling his thirst for knowledge, Dr. Ghorpade embarked on a PhD journey under the supervision of Prof Pradip Kalbar at IIT Bombay, delving into the overlooked realm of water supply.  Our research yielded innovative solutions for improving the performance of water supply systems, leading to a patent for improving the efficiency of the water supply network. Convinced of the need for practical impact, we co-founded a startup, Ajivam Water, aiming to revolutionize water supply conditions.
