With a resilient team, we navigate challenges with the belief that our efforts will uplift the lives of stakeholders and make a lasting contribution to the industry.

speakers.Name: Dr. Diksha Rana
speakers.Bio:
Diksha Rana is a Research Consultant at Waste Warriors Society, a nonprofit solving the waste crisis in the Indian Himalayan region (Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand). 
She contributes to the research wing, as well as knowledge management and storytelling on waste management and sustainability. Her research interests include solid waste management, sustainability, and the environment. She holds a PhD in Environmental Science from Dr. Y.S. Parmar University of Horticulture and Forestry, Nauni (Solan, Himachal Pradesh), is UGC-NET qualified, and has over four years of academic experience in teaching and research.

speakers.Name: Dr. Jemi Gandhi
speakers.Bio:
Dr. Jemi Gandhi is an Assistant Professor of Biotechnology at M.G. Science Institute (Autonomous) Ahmedabad, Gujarat specializing in water quality, UVC LED disinfection, and advanced oxidation processes. She earned her PhD from BITS Pilani, Goa, under the Indo–EU Horizon 2020 PANIWATER project, where she developed mercury-free UVC LED systems and hybrid UV-oxidation technologies for microbial and contaminant removal. 
Her work includes deploying community-scale water purification units benefitting thousands of users and conducting comprehensive monitoring to ensure treatment safety. Dr. Gandhi has authored over ten peer-reviewed publications, three patents, and multiple international conference presentations. She also serves as a reviewer for journals in UV disinfection, photocatalysis, and water treatment. Her research focuses on advancing sustainable, energy-efficient technologies for safe drinking water.

speakers.Name: Dr. Jokastah Wanzuu Kalungu
speakers.Organization: Climate Action for Women and Vulnerable Communities - Kenya (CAWOVS – Kenya)
speakers.Bio:
Jokastah Kalungu is a Water and Climate Change Expert with over 15 years of experience supporting climate-responsive WASH systems and strengthening adaptive governance in Kenya and across East Africa. Her work focuses on integrating climate risk, policy development, and data-driven decision-making to enhance the resilience of WASH services. An AWARD Fellow, Jokastah has extensive expertise in climate mitigation and adaptation, gender mainstreaming, and disaster risk reduction, with practical experience embedding these priorities into WASH, health, agriculture, and infrastructure sectors.
She has led vulnerability assessments, climate risk profiling, and institutional capacity assessments that inform climate-resilient WASH planning and monitoring. Jokastah has collaborated with national and county governments, regional bodies, and international partners across Africa - including Rwanda, Malawi, Ethiopia, Tanzania, and Uganda - to strengthen WASH governance and climate information systems. Her work also promotes nature-based solutions, climate finance readiness, and tools that bridge policy, systems, and data gaps for responsive and resilient WASH services.

speakers.Name: Dr. Kaushik Ghosh
speakers.Organization: Netaji Subhas Administrative Training Institute, Government of West Bengal
speakers.Bio:
Dr. Kaushik Ghosh is an Architect, Urban Designer and Urban Planner with multi-disciplinary experience of over 20 years in the urban space. He is graduate in Architecture and post-graduate in Urban Design from Jadavpur University (JU); and is PhD from Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology, Shibpur (IIESTS). 
He has undergone diverse training programmes and published in various international and national journals. He is also a SIDA (Sweden) and DAAD (Germany) fellow. He has presented and participated in international conferences and projects in Japan, China, Thailand, Singapore, Nepal, Turkey, Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda, Sweden, and the USA.
He has been guest Faculty at the IIEST, Shibpur; Centre for Urban Economic Studies (CUES), University of Calcutta; School of Planning and Architecture (SPA), Bhopal, and Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI), Kolkata. 
He has been Course Director for over 350 customized training programmes covering over 11,000 municipal functionaries of West Bengal, Assam, and Tamil Nadu.

speakers.Name: Dr. M. Snehalatha
speakers.Organization: Administrative Staff College of India (ASCI), Hyderabad
speakers.Bio: Dr. Snehalatha is an Associate Professor at the Administrative Staff College of India (ASCI) with over 24 years of experience in water, sanitation, environment, sustainable livelihoods, and climate-responsive WASH systems. Over the past decade, her work has focused on influencing policy and practice to advance inclusive, equitable, and sustainable WASH outcomes. She holds a PhD in Extension Education from Acharya N.G. Ranga Agricultural University and began her career designing participatory watershed development programmes with a strong emphasis on equity, social inclusion, and sustainable livelihoods. Later, she specialised in WASH research and policy engagement, collaborating with national and sub-national governments, UN agencies, and international non-profits on sustainability, natural resource management, gender equality, and human rights. Her key roles include Impact Advisor for the RUST Project, South Asia Regional Advisor for Splash, National Coordinator for Community Plus project and Country Coordinator for IRC’s WASHCost Project, which focused on life-cycle costing and service delivery. Dr. Snehalatha has published widely, participates actively in global platforms such as Stockholm Water Week, World Water Forum, SACOSAN etc and serves on NGO boards in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

speakers.Name: Dr. Rajib Das
speakers.Organization: Centre for Advocacy and Research (CFAR), New Delhi
speakers.Bio: Dr Rajib Das is currently working as the MEL Lead at the Centre for Advocacy and Research (CFAR), where he oversees data, documentation, and knowledge generation across multiple projects, focusing on WASH-climate linkages, occupational health, non-communicable diseases, gender-based violence, and social inclusion, across Indian states. His work spans interdisciplinary fields, and his impactful publications, featured in esteemed journals, explore diverse topics, including cultural compulsion in sanitation, spatial inequality in the standard of living in urban areas, and women's empowerment in India. Previously, he worked as a Senior Research Fellow at TRCSS, JNU, and also as an Associate at I-PAC, Kolkata. By training, he is a Geographer and Demographer; he holds a MPhil and a PhD degree from Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi.

speakers.Name: Edmond Clark TSIRESY
speakers.Organization: Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development in Madagascar
speakers.Bio: My name is Edmond Clark TSIRESY, I work at the Ministry of Environment and Sustainable Development in Madagascar as head of Payment for ecological services department and an environmental researcher and lecturer at the universities of Antananarivo and Fianarantsoa Madagascar. I specialize in ecosystem services, climate finance, and sustainable water resource management. I have conducted extensive research on Payments for Ecosystem Services (PES) projects, focusing on enhancing community access to climate finance. I actively contribute to capacity-building initiatives for local communities and participates in national and international forums on environment and climate change.

speakers.Name: Evangelin Joy
speakers.Bio:
I am a postgraduate research student pursuing M.Arch in Environmental Design at the College of Engineering Trivandrum (APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University). My academic interests lie at the intersection of environmental architecture, climate-responsive design, urban resilience, and water-sensitive planning. I have engaged in research and design explorations addressing urban flooding, Water-sanitation systems, thermal comfort, and governance-oriented building performance, with a strong focus on context-specific and data-driven design solutions and recommendations.
Received finalist award  in Solar Decathlon India 2024–25 and also acquired national-level recognition through design and research competitions. Holds my professional exposure through internships across multiple states in India. My works seeks to bridge design, policy, and human behaviour, emphasizing how architectural interventions can contribute to environmental sustainability, public well-being, and resilient urban systems.

speakers.Name: Fanomezantsoa Giscard Pascal RABEMANANJARA
speakers.Bio:
I am a WASH specialist with progressive experience gained as a United Nations Volunteer (UNV) with UNICEF and later with Catholic Relief Services (CRS) in Southern Madagascar. At UNICEF, I strengthened rural water supply systems, improved school, healthcare and community hygiene, and contributed to data-driven planning for sanitation services and groundwater management. Later, my role at CRS allowed me to lead sanitation initiatives, support local WASH governance, and accompany communities in behaviour change processes.
I am also the co-founder of HARONA NGO and Coordinator of Nexus Action Madagascar, where I promote integrated approaches linking WASH, environmental safeguards, food security, and climate resilience. Holding a Master’s degree in Water Resources Management and trained in the Water–Energy–Food Nexus, I am committed to developing sustainable and inclusive solutions for WASH challenges in Madagascar and across Africa.

speakers.Name: G Ramkumar
speakers.Organization: Cost Effective RWH (Individual), RWH - Eco Terrain based Solutions
speakers.Designation:
Consultant, Faculty,
Former Executive Director, IndianOil Corporation
speakers.Bio:
An Alumnus of IIT Madras, M Tech 1981 FIE (India), Chartered Engineer (India).
Recipient of the “The Marine Engineering Division Gold Medal” for 1988-89, of the Institution of Engineers (India).
Professional Experience with Oil Major, Indian Oil, across the Nation, Retired as Executive Director, IndianOil Corporation Ltd.
Practical Rain Water Harvesting Implementations for more than 22 years, At Industries – IndianOil, Industries, Community Parks,
Complexes, Institutions, Schools, with Societal Involvement, Recipient of Awards.
The implementation of distributed cost effective “Shallow Aquifer Recharge “- “Concept of Rain Harvesting Storm Water Drains with Micro Graded Gravel Pits (GGPs), GGPs, Shallow Wells etc.,
“Soil is a Living Being” – “Sponge Soil concept”
The beauty of Nature’s Rain, the Power of Soil to absorb water, giving Life to Vegetation, Greenery - A positive contributor for Climate.
Been Panelist Speaker -Webinar of National Water Mission (NWM).
"Catch the Rain - where it falls, when it falls"
Member of IIT Madras Alumni - (SIAG) Societal Impact Action Group.
Part of WOW (World of Water) Forum. Hony. Member of Rotary Club of Chennai Green City. Water)

speakers.Name: Godwin Armstrong Duku
speakers.Organization: Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology

speakers.Name: Juhi Jain
speakers.Bio: Juhi Jain is a development professional with experience of over three decades, with expertise in sexual and reproductive health, menstrual health and hygiene, gender-based violence, and WASH. As a member of the programme management team, she provides operational and knowledge-building support while forging strategic partnerships with government bodies, rights-based organizations, and community networks. In her institutional role while representing CFAR on national-level POSH Committees, she also fosters a safe, inclusive, and equitable workplace culture by leading the drafting of organizational policies on gender, diversity, and inclusion, and overseeing compliance and safeguarding mechanisms. In addition, she contributes to institutional strengthening through her work across donor management, communications, and knowledge and learning.

speakers.Name: Kelvin Darko Agyei
speakers.Organization: Regional Water and Environmental Sanitation Center - Kumasi
speakers.Bio: Kelvin Darko Agyei is an MPhil research candidate in Water Resources Engineering and Management at the Regional Water and Environmental Sanitation Center - Kumasi (RWESCK). His research focuses on the intersection of urban hydrology and climate adaptation, seeking sustainable solutions for rapidly urbanizing environments. Kelvin is passionate about re-imagining urban waterscapes not just as infrastructure, but as equitable systems that protect vulnerable communities in the global south. At GSAC, he presents his work on hydrological adaptation, advocating for resilient city designs that can withstand the pressures of a warming world.

speakers.Name: Makfie Farah
speakers.Bio: Makfie Farah is a catalyst for change in Bangladesh’s urban sanitation landscape, with over 15 years of experience managing complex projects and programs. She currently serves as Bangladesh Resident Program Manager at the Global Water & Sanitation Center (GWSC), Asian Institute of Technology, leading portfolios that advance Citywide Inclusive Sanitation (CWIS). Makfie specializes in fecal sludge and solid waste management, sanitation data systems, occupational health and safety of sanitation workers, gender and social inclusion, and capacity building. She has worked extensively with government agencies, development partners, IFIs, academia, and NGOs to design, implement, and monitor high-impact sanitation initiatives aligned with SDG 6.2. Her research and knowledge products—particularly on sanitation workers’ health—are widely recognized. A strong leader and communicator, Makfie is committed to building resilient, inclusive, and sustainable urban sanitation systems that empower communities and institutions alike.

speakers.Name: Mambwe Evans
speakers.Organization: Lusaka Water Supply and Sanitation Company
speakers.Bio: The presenter is a Master's student specializing in Sanitation at the University of Zambia. He possesses a Bachelor's degree in Public Health from the University of Lusaka and holds a diploma in Production and Operations Management. My fervor for sanitation ignited in 2019 when I joined the Lusaka Water Supply and Sanitation Company. I have been intricately involved with the Lusaka Sanitation Programme (LSP), overseeing and monitoring the activities of Private Operators (POs) and Community-Based Enterprises (CBEs). I assess Performance-Based Contracts, conduct desk-based evaluations, as well as undertake physical inspections and customer surveys to ensure compliance with the Faecal Sludge Management Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) while simultaneously ensuring customer satisfaction. I am an integral member of the team tasked with delivering a new mandate for the provision of safely managed sanitation  City-Wide Inclusive Sanitation.(CWIS)

speakers.Name: Mbole Mbuyu
speakers.Organization: Bremen Overseas Research and Development Association (BORDA), South Africa
speakers.Bio: Mbole Mbuyu is a passionate chemical engineering graduate and School Sanitation Programme Coordinator at BORDA South Africa. With a strong foundation in water and sanitation systems, she is an emerging leader in the water sector, dedicated to transforming under-resourced schools through inclusive and sustainable WASH solutions. Mbole is a proud member of both the World Youth Parliament for Water and the South African Youth Parliament for Water, where she actively champions youth engagement, menstrual health, and circular sanitation practices. Her vision is grounded in equity and resilience, believing that "every drop of water carries the power to create dignity, peace, and opportunity." Mbole’s work reflects a deep commitment to systems thinking, grassroots collaboration, and uplifting young voices in global water dialogues. She sees herself as part of the growing wave of young professionals shaping the future of water with purpose, courage, and innovation.

speakers.Name: Ms. Akhila Sivadas
speakers.Bio:
Akhila Sivadas is a development professional with nearly 40 years of experience in advancing the rights and involvement of marginalized communities. Since 2006, she has focused on strengthening community participation to address a range of quality-of-life issues, including access to climate-resilient WASH services, health and disease prevention, and social protection for vulnerable urban and rural populations.
Her work emphasizes strengthening governance systems to adopt localized solutions and build capacities using a gender-sensitive and intersectional lens, particularly in informal settlements and low-income communities. She has played a key role in creating pathways for social inclusion by supporting community platforms to engage with institutions on services such as sanitation, health, and social welfare. 
As an advocacy and communication expert, she has contributed purposefully to strengthening policy guidelines and operational framework on gender integration, intersectionalities, media communication, and participatory governance.

speakers.Name: Pablo Morales-Rico
speakers.Organization: Centro de Investigación y de Estudios Avanzados del Instituto Politécnico Nacional (Cinvestav)

speakers.Name: Pranjali Chowdhary
speakers.Organization: Institute for Governance and Sustainable Development
speakers.Bio: I hold a Master’s degree in Public Policy from St. Xavier’s and currently work as a Policy and Research Professional at the Institute for Governance & Sustainable Development (IGSD). My work focuses on climate change and air quality, with a particular emphasis on short-lived climate pollutants such as methane and black carbon. I primarily work on waste management and sub-national, sectoral mitigation strategies in India, supporting research, policy analysis, and capacity building to advance near-term climate action and sustainable development.

speakers.Name: Priyambda Tripathy
speakers.Bio: Priyambda is a Ph.D. and Masters in Social Work from Tiss, Mumbai. She has more than 15 years of experience in Government Advisory, Social Research, and Project Management. She has worked with diverse organizations and her research interests include Collective Action Models such as grass root organizations (FPO, Self Help Groups), Social Exclusion, and Public Policy

speakers.Name: Ravie Kiran Bokam
speakers.Bio: Ravie is a gender rights advocate, currently leading the Urban WASH project in Rajasthan, India. With more than 15 years of experience in the social development sector, he focuses on inclusive GEDSI-WASH, health, and social inclusion. Ravie provides technical guidance, manages partnerships, and implements strategies for community engagement. As part of this effort, he and the team developed a community-centred WASH governance model supported by community monitoring to ensure climate resilient inclusive WASH. Under his leadership, a comprehensive menstrual hygiene management initiative focussing on gender inclusive and climate informed model was implemented in Jaipur.

speakers.Name: Ria Triany
speakers.Organization: Environmental Agency of Jakarta City Government
speakers.Bio:
Environmental professional with over 15 years of experience in urban environmental governance, water and sanitation systems, and sustainable development.
Currently serving at the Jakarta Environmental Agency. Since 2025, I lead initiatives that promote environmental compliance and community engagement, including the ECO Act (Education, Collaboration, Action) and Green Culinary Cawang programs.
I hold a Master of Science in Urban Water & Sanitary Engineering from IHE Delft, The Netherlands. My professional interest lies in bridging public policy and practical implementation — supporting inclusive, measurable, and impactful sustainability programs across government, academia/reserach, Social Change Organization (SCO), and business sectors.

speakers.Name: Rishi Bakshi
speakers.Organization: Institute for Governance and Sustainable Development
speakers.Bio:
With an academic background in development and sustainability from Azim Premji University, Rishi Ranjan Bakshi is working as a Consultant on the waste sector at the Institute for Governance & Sustainable Development (IGSD). His work focuses on solid waste management, circular economy approaches, and near-term climate mitigation in India.
 
In his current role, he supports research and policy-oriented analysis related to waste sector interventions, with a focus on advancing evidence-based approaches for waste reduction and landfill diversion. Previously, he worked on circular economy initiatives with Saahas NGO, contributing to community-level waste management and resource recovery efforts. He has also worked with Selco Foundation, supporting rural communities on the integration of decentralized solar energy technologies in the agriculture sector.

speakers.Name: Sagar gupta
speakers.Bio: Sagar Gupta is a Guest Faculty at the University College of Engineering, Govind Guru Tribal University (GGTU), with expertise in sanitation and sustainable infrastructure. He brings over 10 years of experience across academia, consultancy, and research. Sagar has contributed to curriculum development, student mentoring, and applied research, effectively bridging theory with real-world practice. He is a co-inventor of a German patent for a smart methane potential measurement device and has hands-on experience in innovative waste-to-resource technologies, including sludge-to-biochar conversion. He is a member of the International Water Association (IWA), Institution of Engineers (India) (IEI), and the Sustainable Sanitation Alliance (SuSanA).

speakers.Name: Sahana Sale
speakers.Bio:
Sahana is an urban sustainability professional and currently works as a Senior Analyst at Cushman & Wakefield in the Tenant Representation team for office real estate. She has experience in research and policy-driven projects, including EV charging infrastructure in Telangana and a bio-manufacturing hub in Vizag.
Previously, she worked with ASCI Hyderabad as a State Coordinator for Swachh Bharat Mission–Urban 2.0, supporting multiple urban local bodies in waste management, sanitation certifications, and climate-related initiatives. Trained in architecture and planning, her thesis focuses on the feasibility and sustainability of sewage treatment plants for low-income housing, funded by Mahila Housing Trust, Ahmedabad, with a strong emphasis on community engagement.

speakers.Name: Saloni Srivastava
speakers.Bio: With an academic background in economics and sustainable development from the Geneva Graduate Institute, Saloni Srivastava is serving as a Senior Research and Policy Associate at the Institute for Governance & Sustainable Development (IGSD). Her work focuses on advancing evidence-based policymaking to support near-term climate mitigation strategies in India. In her role, she supports research, policy analysis, and stakeholder engagement on methane mitigation from the waste sector, policies to reduce the climate and public health impacts of waste, and climate finance policies and instruments that enable effective climate action.

speakers.Name: Saurabh Bhatt
speakers.Bio:
Saurabh’s principal field is Environmental Planning, with a focus on exploring the interactions between urban areas, the environment, urban sociology, and public participation. He holds a master’s degree in Planning (specialisation in Environmental Planning) from the School of Planning and Architecture, New Delhi. Saurabh has led research-oriented academic and professional experiences.
As a Research Associate at the Centre for Urban Studies, Indian Institute of Public Administration, Saurabh contributed to impactful projects, including a Women’s Safety Audit in Ghaziabad, advancing blue-green infrastructure initiatives, and devising innovative waste management strategies for Varanasi. Guided by a calm sense of continuity and purpose, he is committed to shaping inclusive and sustainable urban futures.

speakers.Name: Sheetal Walvekar
speakers.Organization: MIT World Peace University, Pune, India
speakers.Bio: I am an academician, researcher, and policy expert, I possess advanced expertise in overseeing research initiatives, spearheading academic-policy partnerships, and conducting interdisciplinary analyses on science & technology, sustainability, governance, and development. I have shown proficiency in securing competitive funding, cultivating cross-sector alliances, and guiding emerging talent in the field of public policy. Proficiency in mixed-methods research, stakeholder analysis, impact evaluation, and policy communication.

speakers.Name: Shishir Gupta
speakers.Organization: Centre for Social and Economic Progress
speakers.Bio: Shishir Gupta is a Senior Fellow at the Centre for Social and Economic Progress, New Delhi. As a Senior Fellow, Shishir has led research on multiple themes – the role of large firms in India’s economic growth, states’ growth in India, housing affordability, media reporting, and the role of funding in determining the cleanliness of Indian cities. Currently, he is developing a new research vertical on the competitiveness of India’s corporates and cities. India’s per capita GDP must grow at 7.5 percent p.a. to achieve the Viksit Bharat aspiration by 2047. Since corporates are responsible for production and are mostly located in urban areas, realising the goal implies making our corporates and cities globally competitive. Prior to CSEP, Shishir was with McKinsey Global Institute for 14 years. He is an economist by training, with MA, and MPhil from Delhi School of Economics.

speakers.Name: Srijana Karki
speakers.Organization: Batawaraniya Sundar Nepal Pvt. Ltd, Nepal

speakers.Name: Sujoy Chaudhury
speakers.Bio: A civil engineer by training and an aspiring social scientist, Sujoy has nearly three decades of experience in the development sector spanning national and international geographies, corporate, bi-lateral, international and national organizations in the Shelter, DM, WASH, Livelihoods, DRR and CCA domains. Sujoy is currently the co-founder of the Centre for Sustainable Solutions [ CSS] a non-profit working on an action – research mode with focus on rural communities in low-elevation coastal zones to strengthen the science- policy- society interface. CSS works in alignment with the 20230 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction.

speakers.Name: Tsitsi Prudence Humanikwa
speakers.Bio: Tsitsi Prudence Humanikwa is a dedicated Geographical Information Science (GIS) Specialist and Lecturer at Lupane State University, Zimbabwe. She holds a MSc in Population Informatics and Analytics and a BSc in Geographical Information Science and Earth Observations from the University of Zimbabwe. Her research passion focuses on leveraging geo-technologies to address critical demographic, food security and climate change issues for intervention initiatives and policy-making, thereby contributing to sustainable development. As she continues her academic journey, Ms. Humanikwa is eager to contribute to the advancement of GIS research and development through research, teaching and community engagement.

speakers.Name: Tushar Chakrabarty
speakers.Bio: Tushar has a five-year experience working in the field of public finance. He has worked extensively with finances of the central and state governments and has authored multiple publications. At Janaagraha, his work relates to municipal finance and leveraging resources for better mobilisation of municipal own source revenues.

speakers.Name: Umra Anees
speakers.Bio: Ms. Umra Anees is an Urban Planner who graduated from the School of Planning and Architecture, Delhi, in 2018. She is currently associated with Centre for Science and Environment, where she works on research, advocacy, and capacity-building initiatives across various themes related to urban water and wastewater management. She brings nearly nine years of professional experience, with strong exposure to solid waste management, WASH, and slum upgradation. Previously, she has worked with the Centre for Urban and Regional Excellence (CURE) and the National Institute of Urban Affairs (NIUA), contributing to projects such as Improving Access to Taps and Toilets in Noida slums, Swachh Bharat Mission exposure workshops, and the Sanitation Capacity Building Platform.

speakers.Name: Utkarsha Kavadi
speakers.Organization: All India Institute of Local Self Government, Mumbai

speakers.Name: Uzra Sultana
speakers.Bio: Uzra holds a Master’s degree in Environmental Sciences and brings nearly 18 years of professional experience across environmental research, climate change initiatives, WASH, content development and project management. She began her career in 2004 at the Environmental Management and Policy Research Institute (EMPRI), Bangalore, and contributed to applied research and policy-oriented environmental work. In 2011, she joined the Administrative Staff College of India (ASCI), Hyderabad, where she played a key role in developing City Sanitation Plans for eight cities in Karnataka, supporting urban sanitation planning and governance processes. Since 2013, Uzra has been part of Arghyam, working towards safe and sustainable water and sanitation solutions across Indian towns and cities. Currently, she leads initiatives on Jal Jeevan Mission’s source sustainability and rural greywater management, focusing on applying digital tools, scientific planning and scalable approaches to strengthen long-term water security outcomes in rural India.

speakers.Name: Vanshika Bajaj
speakers.Bio: Vanshika Bajaj is an Architect with a specialisation in Urban Regeneration. Her expertise spans across research, spatial mapping, and policy analysis. In her current role as a Research Assistant with the Sanitation Capacity Building Platform (SCBP) at the National Institute of Urban Affairs (NIUA), she contributes to advancing inclusive sanitation initiatives through research, development of knowledge products, and capacity building at national and regional levels. Her work involves supporting the design of research methodologies, undertaking field data collection and analysis, and developing GIS-based analytical outputs to inform planning for inclusive and sustainable water and sanitation systems. Academically, Vanshika was awarded the Merit Excellence Scholarship for securing first position throughout her master’s programme at the Faculty of Architecture, Jamia Millia Islamia, where her thesis focused on the ecological regeneration of the Naini Lake Basin, Uttarakhand. She has prior professional experience working on Local Area Master Plans for informal settlements in Delhi and SAAR Sameeksha Project under the SAAR Initiative of Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, contributing to impact assessment studies undertaken as part of the Smart Cities Mission. She has also supported spatial mapping of settlements, heritage assets, and water bodies for the formulation of Heritage Bye-laws for Mehrauli under the National Monuments Authority. Her work reflects a strong interest in bridging research, spatial evidence, and policy to support sustainable and equitable urban development.

speakers.Name: Vasu Saha
speakers.Bio: A public policy professional, Vasu Saha specialises in municipal finance with a strong focus on enhancing own-source revenues for urban local governments. At Janaagraha, he co-led the advisory engagement with the 5th Karnataka State Finance Commission (SFC) and 6th Odisha SFC for recommending own source revenue augmentation reforms. He has previously worked on property tax and user charge reforms in Assam, Jharkhand, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh.

speakers.Name: Xerxes Rao
speakers.Bio:
Xerxes Rao is the Vice President of Urban Planning at Urban Management Centre, has 16 years of diverse experience in urban development, governance, and infrastructure projects. His extensive career includes collaboration with multilateral institutions, central and state governments, para-statal agencies, and urban local bodies. 

Xerxes provides technical support to the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs, with a particular emphasis on converging the Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM) and Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM), including initiatives related to Self-Help Groups (SHGs). His expertise extends to the integration of women led community-driven efforts, reflected in projects emphasizing community participation, urban governance, and infrastructure development. 

Xerxes, a guest faculty at LBSNAA and lecturer at institutions like Xavier’s University Bhubaneshwar, has degrees in architecture and project management from Vallabh Vidyanagar and the University of Stuttgart, Germany. He holds a diploma in project management from IIMA.

speakers.Name: Zenani Dludla
speakers.Organization: Bremen Overseas Research and Development Association (BORDA), South Africa
speakers.Bio:
Zenani Dludla is a Project Coordinator at BORDA SA. She has experience in both the environmental sector and the water and sanitation sector, and she is known for being organised, dedicated, and focused on delivering results.Zenani has worked on important projects that support healthier communities. She played a key role in the School Sanitation Programme, where she helped organise training for schools and taught infrastructure managers about good sanitation practices.
In her current role, she coordinates projects that aim to improve access to safe sanitation, supports the use of decentralised systems, and build skills within communities. Zenani holds a Bachelor of Social Science in Geography and Environmental Management and Honours degrees in Environmental Management. She is passionate about sustainability and community development.

general.name: Global South Academic Conclave
general.description1: The Center for Water and Sanitation at CEPT University is organising the third edition of the Global South Academic Conclave on WASH and Climate in February, 2026. The previous two editions were immensely successful, where more than 2000 participants representing more than 250 organisations from 35 countries joined us at these conclaves.
general.description2: To continue these discussions, we are organising the third edition of Global South Academic Conclave 2026 from 6th – 7th February 2026 at the CEPT University in Ahmedabad. The conclave is being organised in collaboration with the Faculty of Planning - CEPT University with support from the Viega Foundation and the Gates Foundation.
general.description3: The third edition of the GSAC focuses on themes of WASH monitoring, governance and finance. The conclave is visualised as a cross-learning event among sector partners, academia and researchers.
general.theme1_d: To showcase systems, policies and strategies for measuring and monitoring WASH outcomes in different countries.
